Package management

Class Rules

java.lang.Object
management.Rules
public class Rules
extends java.lang.Object
Class use to manage the rules define in the game, this will manage the game Over and the conditions if the user lost, this will manage how the element in a board can be push, or to manage the priority of the properties.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Rules()

    Checks if the player lost or not
    static void managePriority​(Element element)
    Manage the priority of the properties, when an element has more than 1 property, some elements has the priority on the others.
    static void manageRules​(Board gameBoard, fr.umlv.zen5.KeyboardKey action, Element you)
    Manage all the rules in the current level.
    static void pushLoop​(Board gameBoard, Element tmp, Element you)
    Make the element tmp move, tmp become the element pushed and make the element in contact move until the location is empty.

    • Rules

      public Rules()

  • Method Details

    • manageRules

      public static void manageRules​(Board gameBoard, fr.umlv.zen5.KeyboardKey action, Element you)
      Manage all the rules in the current level. Precisely, manage when Elements are in contact : check if an element can push another, or if an element has to be remove from the game, when he is in contact with another element.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - Board of the game
      action - get by the user.
      you - Element which has the property "You".

    • pushLoop

      public static void pushLoop​(Board gameBoard, Element tmp, Element you)
      Make the element tmp move, tmp become the element pushed and make the element in contact move until the location is empty.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - of the board
      tmp - temporary Element to be pushed and then being the pusher
      you - : Element which has the property You

    • checkMovable

      public static boolean checkMovable​(Board gameBoard, int x, int y, int width, int height, Element you)
      Check if the elements with the property "You" can move even when he's pushing others blocs. If he push a bloc with the property "Push" then the function check if this bloc can be move : - if the next position of the board get a bloc without the property "Stop" - if the next position is out of Board
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - Board of the game
      x - of the current position of the Element which is pushing the others
      y - of the current position of the Element which is pushing the others
      width - of the board
      height - of the board
      you - Element which is pushing
      Returns:
      true if the Element you can move, false if not

    • isGameOver

      public static boolean isGameOver​(Board gameBoard, fr.umlv.zen5.ApplicationContext context)
      Checks if the player lost or not
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - of the level
      context - use to exit the application if the game is over
      Returns:
      true if it's game Over, false elsewhere.

    • managePriority

      public static void managePriority​(Element element)
      Manage the priority of the properties, when an element has more than 1 property, some elements has the priority on the others.
      Parameters:
      element - to manage.
